      • setItemValues

        public void setItemValues​(ItemStack stack,
                          boolean p_175112_2_)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this thing. This method has slightly different behavior depending on the interface (for technical reasons the same method is used for both IWorldNameable and ICommandSender):
        INameable.getName()
        Returns the name of this inventory. If this has a custom name then this should be a direct string; otherwise it should be a valid translation string.
        However, note that the translation string may be invalid, as is the case for TileEntityBanner (always returns nonexistent translation code banner without a custom name), BlockAnvil$Anvil (always returns anvil), BlockWorkbench$InterfaceCraftingTable (always returns crafting_table), InventoryCraftResult (always returns Result) and the EntityMinecart family (uses the entity definition). This is not an exaustive list.
        In general, this method should be safe to use on tile entities that implement IInventory.
        ICommandSender.getName() and Entity.getName()
        Returns a valid, displayable name (which may be localized). For most entities, this is the translated version of its translation string (obtained via EntityList.getEntityString).
        If this entity has a custom name set, this will return that name.
        For some entities, this will attempt to translate a nonexistent translation string; see MC-68446. For players this returns the player's name. For ocelots this may return the translation of entity.Cat.name if it is tamed. For item entities, this will attempt to return the name of the item in that item entity. In all cases other than players, the custom name will overrule this.
        For non-entity command senders, this will return some arbitrary name, such as "Rcon" or "Server".
        指定者:
        getName 在接口中 IWorldNameable

      • hasCustomName

        public boolean hasCustomName()
        Checks if this thing has a custom name. This method has slightly different behavior depending on the interface (for technical reasons the same method is used for both IWorldNameable and Entity):
        INameable.hasCustomName()
        If true, then getName() probably returns a preformatted name; otherwise, it probably returns a translation string. However, exact behavior varies.
        Entity.hasCustomName()
        If true, then Entity.getCustomNameTag() will return a non-empty string, which will be used by getName().
        指定者:
        hasCustomName 在接口中 IWorldNameable

      • getDisplayName

        public ITextComponent getDisplayName()
        Returns a displayable component representing this thing's name. This method should be implemented slightly differently depending on the interface (for technical reasons the same method is used for both IWorldNameable and ICommandSender), but unlike getName() this method will generally behave sanely.
        INameable.getDisplayName()
        A normal component. Might be a translation component or a text component depending on the context. Usually implemented as:
        return this.hasCustomName() ? new
 TextComponentString(this.getName()) : new TextComponentTranslation(this.getName());
        ICommandSender.getDisplayName() and Entity.getDisplayName()
        For most entities, this returns the result of getName(), with scoreboard formatting and a special hover event.
        For non-entity command senders, this will return the result of getName() in a text component.
        指定者:
        getDisplayName 在接口中 IWorldNameable
        覆盖:
        getDisplayName 在类中 TileEntity

      • getUpdatePacket

        @Nullable
public SPacketUpdateTileEntity getUpdatePacket()
        Retrieves packet to send to the client whenever this Tile Entity is resynced via World.notifyBlockUpdate. For modded TE's, this packet comes back to you clientside in TileEntity.onDataPacket(net.minecraft.network.NetworkManager, net.minecraft.network.play.server.SPacketUpdateTileEntity)
        覆盖:
        getUpdatePacket 在类中 TileEntity

      • getUpdateTag

        public NBTTagCompound getUpdateTag()
        Get an NBT compound to sync to the client with SPacketChunkData, used for initial loading of the chunk or when many blocks change at once. This compound comes back to you clientside in TileEntity.handleUpdateTag(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound)
        覆盖:
        getUpdateTag 在类中 TileEntity

      • getPatterns

        public static int getPatterns​(ItemStack stack)
        Retrieves the amount of patterns stored on an ItemStack. If the tag does not exist this value will be 0.

      • getPatternList

        public java.util.List<BannerPattern> getPatternList()
        Retrieves the list of patterns for this tile entity. The banner data will be initialized/refreshed before this happens.

      • getColorList

        public java.util.List<EnumDyeColor> getColorList()
        Retrieves the list of colors for this tile entity. The banner data will be initialized/refreshed before this happens.
